moves.1. e4: This was a draw with a very promising 17 year old junior. I was reasonably pleased with my play,although he did miss a great chance, as we shall see
moves.1... c5: So I play the Sicilian Defence
moves.3... e6: Afterwards a team colleagues commented that g6 was a better move. It is more popular, but it is debatable whether it is really better than e6. Nd4 is another option.
moves.5. e5: I am not sure that this is best, 0-0 or d3 are options. He is trying to exploit my weakness
moves.5... Ba6: I tried to stop him castling
moves.6... c4: I plan to exchange my doubled pawn.
moves.7. O-O: He falls in with my plan,rather than playing d4!
moves.10. d4: I think this is weak as his bishop is in danger of becoming weak
moves.15. Ng5 h6:
This is playing with fire! he should have played 16.	Nxe6	fxe6 17.	Rxe6+ for instance	Kd7 18.	Qf5	Rf8 19.	Rxd6+	Kxd6 20.	Bf4+	Ke7 21.	Re1+	
CHECK wins for white. If 17.....Be7 then Ba3 and Re1 win for white. If 17......Kf7 then 18. Qg6+ and white wins the bishop on d6 with a huge advantage. Black may be able to grovel on with a piece for 3 pawns, in some variations, after 17... Kf8, but his Rh8 will be out of the game in those lines.
moves.18... Rfc8: Avoiding the trap,but probably too passive
moves.19... Qd5: Trying to keep control of the white squares
moves.20... Bc4: Trying to cement control of the white squares
moves.26. h3: Giving his king a flight square
moves.29. Re2: Draw agreed, on his suggestion. Many thanks for reading, please leave a comment or two, letting me know how I am doing. Please rate this game with the star system
